result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laval L Hoover

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: No Contact Order

Defendant Laval L Hoover appeared by video.  Attorney Justin Padway appeared by video for Laval L Hoover.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of defendant's previous OWI convictions. Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer D. Sayeg. State rest. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 02. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laval L Hoover appeared by video.  Attorney Justin Padway appeared by video for Laval L Hoover.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present but a subpoena was issued. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. Court acknowledges the motion. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:39 AM Defendant Laval L Hoover in court.  Attorney Justin Padway in court for Laval L Hoover.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Justin Padway as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Padway accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 11/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laval L Hoover appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defendant is not SPD Eligible. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing to the trial court.
Indigency hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laval L Hoover in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Laval L Hoover appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Proposed No Contact Order

Defendant Laval L Hoover in court, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Laval L Hoover in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Laval L Hoover in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laval L Hoover appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IS NEEDED TO VERIFY ELIGIBILITY.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
